title: How to Make Peda

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
1 stick of butter, softened to room temperature
1 can or tin of sweetened, condensed milk
1 1/2 cups of milk powder
1/4 teaspoon of cardamom powder.

steps.headline: Place the butter and condensed milk in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix together until combined.

steps.headline: Put the mixture into the microwave.
steps.description: Microwave for 2 minutes or until the mixture bubbles.

steps.headline: Remove from the microwave.
steps.description: Add the milk powder and stir through.

steps.headline: Return to the microwave.
steps.description: Heat for 1 minute.

steps.headline: Remove and stir.
steps.description: Heat for 1 minute more, then stir in the cardamom powder.

steps.headline: Allow the dough to cool sufficiently to handle.
steps.description: Roll into small balls.

steps.headline: Press down on a ball with a spool.
steps.description: This will both flatten the ball and create a pattern on it.

steps.headline: Remove the spool.
steps.description: The sweet is completed. Let it cool, then serve. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
2 cups of milk powder
4 cups sweetened condensed milk
3 tablespoons of ghee
1/10 teaspoon saffron
1 tablespoon pistachio, chopped (optional)

steps.headline: Pour 2 tablespoons of warm condensed milk into a bowl.
steps.description: Add the saffron to it. Allow to soak.

steps.headline: Heat the non-stick pan.
steps.description: Add the milk powder and remaining condensed milk to the pan.

steps.headline: Stir constantly over low heat or a low flame.
steps.description: Continue stirring until it forms a smooth dough, free of lumps.

steps.headline: Keeping the heat low, add the ghee.
steps.description: Continue to mix constantly.

steps.headline: Add the saffron milk.
steps.description: Keep stirring continuously; it must not burn.

steps.headline: After stirring for about 6 to 8 minutes, you'll find that the mixture turns soft and sticky.
Turn off the heat source.
steps.description: Allow the mixture to cool to touch point.

steps.headline: Spread little butter or ghee in your hands.
steps.description: Start making round shaped ladoos from the dough. Press down slightly to flatten just a little.

steps.headline: Place some chopped pistachios in the middle of each peda.
steps.description: The sweets are now ready for serving. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
1 cup mawa/khoya, grated or crushed
1/2 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cocoa powder
Cashew nuts as garnish.

steps.headline: Place the mawa and sugar into a pan.
Cook over a low heat.
steps.description: Stir constantly. The mawa and sugar are sufficiently cooked when it starts to pull away from the sides of the pan. There should be no more moisture left.

steps.headline: Add the cocoa powder.
steps.description: Stir through to combine thoroughly.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Transfer to a plate and allow to cool enough to handle.

steps.headline: Start shaping the warm chocolate dough.
steps.description: Divide evenly into small balls. Then flatten slightly.

steps.headline: Finish by placing a whole cashew nut in the center of each chocolate peda.
Serve.
steps.description: If keeping beyond the first day of making, store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
1/2 bowl malai (milk cream)
1/2 cup sugar
Kesar (food coloring).

steps.headline: Warm the malai over a low heat.
Add the sugar.
steps.description: Mix the sugar in until it dissolves into the malai.

steps.headline: Add the kesar.
steps.description: Stir through to add color and scent to the peda (bhini smell and chan color).

steps.headline: Form small balls from the dough.
steps.description: Press down slightly.

steps.headline: Arrange on a serving plate.
steps.description: Serve.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
1 cup paneer
1/2 cup sugar
Rosewater
Dried culinary rose petals.

steps.headline: Add the paneer and sugar to the pan.
steps.description: Place over a low heat.

steps.headline: Stir in the same direction constantly, to dissolve the sugar into the paneer.
Add the rosewater.
steps.description: Stir through to distribute evenly.

steps.headline: Shape the peda.
steps.description: Divide evenly into balls, then press down lightly.

steps.headline: Press a small dried rose petal into each peda for a garnish.
Serve.
steps.description: Arrange on a serving tray for a nice presentation. If keeping beyond the day of making, store in the refrigerator in an airtight container.

text:
Doodh peda (microwave) Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
1 stick of butter, softened to room temperature
1 can or tin of sweetened, condensed milk
1 1/2 cups of milk powder
1/4 teaspoon of cardamom powder. Place the butter and condensed milk in a mixing bowl. Mix together until combined. Put the mixture into the microwave. Microwave for 2 minutes or until the mixture bubbles. Remove from the microwave. Add the milk powder and stir through. Return to the microwave. Heat for 1 minute. Remove and stir. Heat for 1 minute more, then stir in the cardamom powder. Allow the dough to cool sufficiently to handle. Roll into small balls. Press down on a ball with a spool. This will both flatten the ball and create a pattern on it. Remove the spool. The sweet is completed. Let it cool, then serve. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Saffron and pistachio peda Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
2 cups of milk powder
4 cups sweetened condensed milk
3 tablespoons of ghee
1/10 teaspoon saffron
1 tablespoon pistachio, chopped (optional) Pour 2 tablespoons of warm condensed milk into a bowl. Add the saffron to it. Allow to soak. Heat the non-stick pan. Add the milk powder and remaining condensed milk to the pan. Stir constantly over low heat or a low flame. Continue stirring until it forms a smooth dough, free of lumps. Keeping the heat low, add the ghee. Continue to mix constantly. Add the saffron milk. Keep stirring continuously; it must not burn. After stirring for about 6 to 8 minutes, you'll find that the mixture turns soft and sticky.  Turn off the heat source. Allow the mixture to cool to touch point. Spread little butter or ghee in your hands. Start making round shaped ladoos from the dough. Press down slightly to flatten just a little. Place some chopped pistachios in the middle of each peda. The sweets are now ready for serving. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Chocolate peda Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
1 cup mawa/khoya, grated or crushed
1/2 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cocoa powder
Cashew nuts as garnish. Place the mawa and sugar into a pan.  Cook over a low heat. Stir constantly. The mawa and sugar are sufficiently cooked when it starts to pull away from the sides of the pan. There should be no more moisture left. Add the cocoa powder. Stir through to combine thoroughly. Remove from the heat. Transfer to a plate and allow to cool enough to handle. Start shaping the warm chocolate dough. Divide evenly into small balls. Then flatten slightly. Finish by placing a whole cashew nut in the center of each chocolate peda.  Serve. If keeping beyond the first day of making, store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Malai (milk cream) peda Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
1/2 bowl malai (milk cream)
1/2 cup sugar
Kesar (food coloring). Warm the malai over a low heat.  Add the sugar. Mix the sugar in until it dissolves into the malai. Add the kesar. Stir through to add color and scent to the peda (bhini smell and chan color). Form small balls from the dough. Press down slightly. Arrange on a serving plate. Serve. Rose peda Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
1 cup paneer
1/2 cup sugar
Rosewater
Dried culinary rose petals. Add the paneer and sugar to the pan. Place over a low heat. Stir in the same direction constantly, to dissolve the sugar into the paneer.  Add the rosewater. Stir through to distribute evenly. Shape the peda. Divide evenly into balls, then press down lightly. Press a small dried rose petal into each peda for a garnish.  Serve. Arrange on a serving tray for a nice presentation. If keeping beyond the day of making, store in the refrigerator in an airtight container.
